msDesc.head: Prayer book in Latin and English; England, c. 1460

msContents.summary: Prayer book in Latin and English. Prayers from the Middle English section of the manuscript are present in a small collection of other late medieval devotional books, see Erler (2008) p.514 for details. Nearly all the English section has been transcribed by J. C. Hirsh (1970).

msItem.title: Excerpt from the Gospel of Luke

msItem.incipit: Stella celi extirpavit
msItem.note: Hymn (Chevalier 19438) with accompanying prose meditation. For edition see Surtees Society v.132 (1920) p.69.

msItem.incipit: Ave rosa sine spinis
msItem.note: Hymn (Chevalier 2084). For edition see Surtees Society v.132 (1920) p.136.

msItem.title: Two versions of the hymn 'Ave Maria ancilla sancte trinitatis'
msItem.note: The second is Chevalier 1872; editions of both can be found on Surtees Society v.132 (1920) p.137.

msItem.incipit: Stabat Mater dolorosa
msItem.note: Hymn (Chevalier 19416). Edition on pp.134-135 of Surtees Society v.132.

msItem.incipit: Interveniat pro nobis, quesumus, Jesu Christe
msItem.note: An intercessional prayer. See Surtees Society v.132 (1920) p.147.

msItem.incipit: Crux xpi sit mecum
msItem.note: Short prayer expressing adoration for the Cross. Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, The Royal Library, Ms. GkS 1612 4° (See transcription of fol.34).

msItem.incipit: Aspice ad me infelicem pietas imensa
msItem.note: A prayer; see Surtees Society v.132 p.174.

msItem.incipit: Deus propicius est michi peccatori
msItem.note: A prayer; see Surtees Society v.132 p.125.

msItem.incipit: Domine iesu christi qui septem verba ultimo
msItem.note: A prayer; see Surtees Society v.132 pp.141-2.

msItem.title: Four prayers praising the Holy Name
msItem.incipit: O bone iesu o dulcis iesu
O rex gloriose inter sanctos tuos
Deus qui gloriosum nomen iesu christi
Sanctifica me domine iesu christe
msItem.note: See Surtees Society v.132 pp.82-85.

msItem.incipit: Angele qui meus es custos
msItem.note: A prayer for protection from the angels. Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek CMB Pergament 19 4° (See transcription of fols.100v-101r).

msItem.title: A prayer to St. Sebastian
msItem.incipit: O quam glorios refulgent gracia sebastianus dei martir
msItem.note: Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek CMB Pergament 19 4° (See transcription of fols.103r-103v).

msItem.title: A prayer to St. Christopher
msItem.incipit: Martyr christofore pro salvatoris honore
msItem.note: Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek CMB Pergament 19 4° (See transcription of fols.104r-104v).

msItem.title: A prayer to St. George
msItem.incipit: O Georgi martyr inclite te decet laus
msItem.note: Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek CMB Pergament 19 4° (See transcription of fols.104v-105r).

msItem.title: A prayer to St. Anthony
msItem.incipit: O Anthoni pastor inclite qui cruciatos reficis
msItem.note: Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek CMB Pergament 19 4° (See transcription of fols.106v-107r).

msItem.title: A prayer to the Blessed Virgin and St. Anne
msItem.incipit: Ave maria qui plena dominus tecum tua gratia
msItem.note: A short, simple prayer; text in Blackburn (1999), p.174 note 22.

msItem.title: A prayer to St. Anne
msItem.incipit: Celeste beneficium introivit in annam
msItem.note: Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek CMB Pergament 19 4° (See transcription of fols.108v-109r).

msItem.title: A prayer to St. Apollonia
msItem.incipit: Virgo christi egregia pro nobis apolonia
msItem.note: Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek CMB Pergament 19 4° (See transcription of fols.110v-111r).

msItem.title: Two prayers to St Dorothea
msItem.incipit: Salve virgo dorothea audi queso vota mea
Omnipotens sempiterne deus in cuius nomine gloriosa virgo
msItem.note: The first is n.896 in F.J. Mone (1855) Vol.3; the second can be found in Horstmann (1880), p.328.

msItem.title: Prayers for protection and against plague
msItem.incipit: Per signum thau a peste epidimie libera nos iesu
msItem.note: Similar, but not identical, to the prayer against the common plague printed in an anthology of prayers against sickness by Paul Bush (d.1558), available here.

msItem.title: A prayer to St. Roche in time of plague
msItem.note: Text and translation are printed in J. Patrick (1674) 'Reflexions upon the devotions of the Roman church with the prayers, hymns and lessons themselves' (available here), p.248.

msItem.title: A prayer to St. Erasmus
msItem.note: See edition on pp.128-9 of Surtees Society v.132.

msItem.incipit: Maria pepit christum anna mariam elizabeth Iohannem
msItem.note: Charm for protection in childbirth. See L'Estrange (2005).

msItem.incipit: Veni creator spiritus
msItem.note: A common hymn (Chevalier 34378). Text can be found, for example, in S. Harrison Thomson (1939).

msItem.incipit: Deus cui omne cor patet
msItem.note: Short prayer; see p.98 of Surtees Society v.132.

msItem.incipit: Omnipotens dominus christus messias sother
msItem.note: Meditation on the names of Christ. See p.126 of Surtees Society v.132.

msItem.title: Excerpts from the Old Testament
msItem.note: Including: Exodus 15:2, Exodus 15:11-13, Genesis 24:27, Numbers 6:34-6, Jonah 1:3-8, Psalm 12:4-5, Psalm 30:6, Psalm 38:5, Psalm 115:7-8, Psalm 141:5-6, Psalm 85:17, Psalm 4:7, Psalm 31:5, Psalm 12:5-6.

msItem.incipit: Omnipotens sempiterne deus qui ezechie regi
msItem.note: A prayer to be read after reading scripture. Text printed in W. H. Black and T. Brampton (1842) ' A paraphrase on the seven penitential Psalms in English verse' (available here ).

msItem.incipit: Iesu fili dei omnium conditor adiuva me
msItem.note: Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek CMB Pergament 19 4° (See transcription of fol.134r).

msItem.title: A prayer against thunder
msItem.incipit: Titulus triumphalis iesus nazarenus rex iudeorum crucifixus
msItem.note: Text can be found at manuscripts.org, a transcription of Copenhagen, Kongelige Bibliotek CMB Pergament 19 4° (See transcription of fols.134v-135r).

msItem.incipit: O Glorius god redemer of mankynde
msItem.note: DIMEV 3908. See Hirsh (1970) for transcription.

msItem.incipit: O vernicle I honor him and thee
msItem.note: DIMEV 4083. See Hirsh (1970) for transcription.

msItem.incipit: Ave vulnus lateris nostri saluatoris
msItem.note: Hymn (Chevalier 24031). See Hirsh (1970) for transcription.

msItem.incipit: The numbre of the droppes of blode
msItem.note: DIMEV 5425. See Hirsh (1970) for transcription.

msItem.incipit: Gracious lorde for thy bitter passion
msItem.note: DIMEV 1655. See Hirsh (1970) for transcription.

msItem.incipit: Blessed mary moder virginall
msItem.note: DIMEV 868. See Hirsh (1970) for transcription.

msItem.title: A prayer to St. George
msItem.incipit: Of saynt George oure ladyes knyght
msItem.note: Introductory couplet listed as DIMEV 4204) with subsequent prose meditation. Edition of both in Hirsh (1970).

msItem.title: A prayer to St. Sebastian
msItem.incipit: Of the blessyd martir saynt Sebastyane
msItem.note: Introductory couplet listed as DIMEV 4216 with subsequent prose meditation. Edition of both in Hirsh (1970).

msItem.textLang: Latin with introductory couplet in Middle English
msItem.title: A prayer to St. Roche
msItem.incipit: Of the blessyd confessor Saynt Roche
msItem.note: Introductory couplet is DIMEV 4215. Fol. 82v is badly rubbed and hard to read: perhaps chants associated with the feast of St Roche; see feast record in cantusdatabase.org.

supportDesc.foliation: Folio numbers added in pencil. Some folios also have numbers added in ink, which appear to be older, and are occasionally erroneous.
supportDesc.collation: Hard to ascertain: too tightly bound. Perhaps mostly in quires of 8 as argued by Hirsch.
supportDesc.condition: Geneally good with occasional small stains, smudges and fading. Hirsh describes a bookplate of Douce's that was attached to the inner front cover; this has since fallen out or been removed, leaving the frontpaper slighlty damaged. Leather is worn and slightly cracked in places.

layoutDesc.layout: One column of 12 or 13 lines except where there are illustrations. Written space 51 35 Ruled in red ink.

decoDesc.summary: Pächt and Alexander iii. 1064, pl. C:
decoDesc.decoNote: Painted miniature on fol. 1v. Standing figure of St. Luke holding a book. Painted with red, blue, and green. Faded.
Simple illuminated initials used throughout; gold with either red or blue backgrounds. Gold is faded or completely worn in some places.

The English prayers are illustrated with simple pen drawings.
Fol. 54v Christ carrying the cross (faded).
Fol. 55v Vernicle.
Fol. 57r Pelican bleeding for her young.
Fols. 57v-69r illustrations depicting scenes from the Passion, and the instruments in particular.
Fol. 71r Christ sitting with bound hands.
Fols. 72r-76r the Five Wounds of Christ.
Fol. 78r St George slaying the dragon.
Fol. 80r St Sebastian shot with arrows.
Fol. 81v St Roche.

physDesc.additions: Along with the summary catalogue number and current shelfmark on the verso side of fol. (i), there is also a faint addition in pencil: 'No 26.'

binding.p: Red leather, French, late eighteenth-century, probably attributable to Richard ('David' or 'Davy') Wier for Count Justin MacCarthy Reagh (see Provenance),. Embossing on the spine reads 'EVANGIL / LATIN / ET ANG. / MSS / SUR VELIN'.

history.provenance: Count MacCarthy Reagh: his binding; likely identifiable with 'Gospels in Latin and English with drawings in 24°' that is lot 1556 in the McCarthy Sale of May 1789. Douce's personal copy of the sales catalogue (Douce CC 301) indicates he paid 15s 8d for the item.
history.acquisition: Bequeathed by Douce to the Bodleian in 1834.

recordHist.source: Description by Ruth Allen, Oct. 2024; date follows Pächt and Alexander III (1973), 1064. Summary Catalogue, vol. 4, p. 489

listBibl.bibl: B. Blackburn (1999), 'The Virgin in the Sun: Music and Image for a Prayer Attributed to Sixtus IV', in Journal of the Royal Musical Association 124.2 (1999), pp.157-195.
M. Erler (1999), 'Devotional Literature' in Hellinga and Trapp, The Cambridge History of the Book in Britain Vol. 3
S. Harrison Thomson, 'Three Anglo-Norman Translations of "Veni Creator Spiritus" ', Medium Aevum 8.1 (1939), pp.33-39.
J. C. Hirsh (1970), A study of English Devotional Poetry in the Fifteenth Century: Bodleian Library MS Douce 1 [PhD Thesis: Lehigh University]
J. C. Hirsh (1968), 'Two English Devotional Poems of the Fifteenth Century', Notes and Queries 15.1 pp.4-11

E. L'Estrange, 'Anna peperit Mariam, Elizabeth Johannem, Maria Christum: Images of Childbirth in Late-Medieval Manuscripts', in B. Dekeyzer and J. Van der Stock (eds.), Manuscripts in Transition: Recycling Manuscripts, Texts and Images (Paris : Peeters, 2005) pp. 335-46.
F. J. Mone, Lateinische Hymen des Mittelalters, Vol. 3 (Freiburg im Breisgau : Herder 1855)
Surtees Society (1920), Horae Eboracenses: The prymer or hours of the blessed virgin mary according to the illustrious church of York, Publications of the Surtees Society Vol. 132

James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
